intro: Carduus pumilus, commonly known as the dwarf thistle, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters, featuring a basal rosette of spiny, hairy leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months, followed by prickly, spherical seed heads. It thrives in dry, sunny environments such as rocky soils and open fields. Botanically, it belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and fibrous roots.
